thread.title: Candidates for Charleston City Council, District 9
thread.title_full: Candidates for Charleston City Council, District 9 - Post and Courier

author: postandcourier.com
title: Candidates for Charleston City Council, District 9
text:
Aubry Alexander × Aubry Alexander Age: 62
Residence: Huntington Woods, West Ashley
Occupation: Real Estate broker
Education: Bachelor’s degree in political science, Baptist College at Charleston
Political experience: Charleston City Council member since 2007
Contact information: (843) 810-2853, aubryalexander9@gmail.com , voteaubry.com
How I spend my spare time: Reading, fishing, and an occasional round of golf at Muni
What makes me qualified for this office: Residents know I listen to them, respond to them and provide responsible, reasonable and reliable leadership. My business experience and community involvement aid the success.
If elected, my top priority would be: Enhancing West Ashley’s quality of life and growing Charleston’s economy will continue to be my top priorities. You need both to happen simultaneously.
Peter Shahid Age: 60
Residence: Northbridge subdivision
Occupation: Attorney, manager of The Shahid Group, LLC, a real estate investment company
Education: Bachelor’s degree and law degree, University of South Carolina
Political experience: None
Contact information: (843) 323-6474, peter@shahidforcharleston.com , www.shahidforcharleston.com
How I spend my spare time: Reading presidential biographies, jogging, boating and walking my Lab, A.J.
What makes me qualified for this office: Most importantly, I love our city and have a new vision for West Ashley. I possess a positive record as a community leader, successful business person, federal prosecutor and attorney.
If elected, my top priority would be: West Ashley has been ignored. I will seek to revitalize West Ashley, including developing Citadel Mall and implementing a comprehensive plan to ensure the efficient flow of traffic and people.
